dt: {bc}a short piece remaining on a stem or trunk where a branch has been lost
{bc}something made or worn to a short or blunt shape
{bc}a pen with a short blunt nib
{bc}a short blunt part left after a larger part has been broken off or used up
{bc}a small part of a leaf (as of a checkbook) attached to the spine for memoranda of the contents of the part torn away
{bc}the part of a ticket returned to the user

et: Middle English {it}stubb{/it}, from Old English {it}stybb{/it}; akin to Old Norse {it}stūfr{/it} stump, Greek {it}stypos{/it} stem
shortdef: a short piece remaining on a stem or trunk where a branch has been lost
something made or worn to a short or blunt shape; especially : a pen with a short blunt nib

dt: {bc}to clear (land) by grubbing out rooted growth
{bc}to hew or cut down (a tree) close to the ground
{bc}to extinguish (something, such as a cigarette) by crushing
{bc}to strike (one's foot or toe) against an object

shortdef: to grub up by the roots
to clear (land) by grubbing out rooted growth
to hew or cut down (a tree) close to the ground

dt: {bc}a piece of paper or a digital record that is given to an employee with each paycheck and that shows the amount of money that the employee earned and the amount that was removed for taxes, insurance costs, etc.

dt.t: When a student gets their first job, one thing they need to learn early on is how to read and understand their {wi}pay stub{/wi} …

shortdef: a piece of paper or a digital record that is given to an employee with each paycheck and that shows the amount of money that the employee earned and the amount that was removed for taxes, insurance costs, etc.
